wikipedia_page.main: Peter Norburn (31 December 1930 – 6 June 2017) was an English extra (actor), window cleaner and professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1950s and 1960s. He played at representative level for England, English League XIII, and Lancashire, and at club level for Worsley Boys Club ARLFC, Swinton,  and Salford, as a wing, or second-row, i.e. number 2 or 5, or, 11 or 12.

response: ::Peter Norburn v. Other Nationalities (at Central Park, 28 November 1953)
* Peter Norburn won caps for England while at Swinton 1953 Other Nationalities

Along with Stanley "Stan" Moorhouse, Peter Norburn, Keith Fielding, Stuart Wright, Martin Offiah and Sam Tomkins; having scored four tries, Jim Leytham, jointly holds the record for the most tries scored in an England match, scoring four tries against Other Nationalities at Odsal Stadium, Bradford on 2 January 1905.

Along with James "Jim" Leytham, Stanley "Stan" Moorhouse, Peter Norburn, Keith Fielding, Martin Offiah and Sam Tomkins, having scored four tries, Stuart Wright jointly holds the record for the most tries scored in an England match, scoring four tries against Wales at Knowsley Road, St. Helens on 28 May 1978.
